text: NF-kappaB and AP-1 are critical regulators of inflammatory responses , proliferation and differentiation of T-cells [ 28-30 ] , however , the signal transduction and subsequent cytokine / chemokine expression is not fully understood .

The aim of the present study was to investigate <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> regulation by NF-kappaB and AP-1 in Jurkat T-cells .

text: Our results demonstrated that PMA induced AP-1 activation , indicating a specific activation of the MAPK pathway .
Furthermore , we demonstrated that PMA dependent AP-1 activation in T-cells was delayed ( > 2 h ) and increased following long-term treatment .
MAPK is one of the main signalling pathways in T-cells that regulate cell - and transcriptional activation [ 31 , 32 ] .
Several studies [ 20 , 33 , 34 ] have indicated the importance of AP-1 in T-cell activation and the induction of inflammatory responses [ 35 ] , including pro-inflammatory cytokine release .
In contrast to AP-1 , NF-kappaB activity rapidly increased ( 1 min ) during PMA exposure followed by a down-regulation to the lowest levels at 6 h .

This is in line with Park and colleagues [ 36 ] who demonstrated a rapid increase in NF-kappaB activity following short-term stimulation with PMA , but prolonged challenge resulted in a persistent inhibition of NF-kappaB .

They showed that the inhibition of NF-kappaB was due to PKC - dependent degradation of <extra_id_0> IkappaB kinase beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in response to PMA .

text: Interestingly , the HK E . coli exposure induced NF-kappaB activation without affecting AP-1 activity .

Wang and colleagues [ 37 ] reported an elevated inflammatory response by obtaining expression of <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> following the exposure of T-cells to peptidoglycan .

text: Reduction in NF-kappaB by calcium ionophore following HK E . coli stimulation may be due to the Ca2+ binding protein calmodulin ( CaM ) , which has been shown to negatively regulate <extra_id_0> c-Rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> when activated [ 38 ] .
The regulation of NF-kappaB and AP-1 observed in the present study was in agreement with earlier studies .

T-cells produce a broad range of pro - and anti-inflammatory cytokines , including <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , TNF and <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , in response to infections or other stress factors [ 39 ] .

The assessment of Jurkat T-cell inflammatory responses ( Table 1 ) revealed an enhanced <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression upon exposure to PMA or HK E . coli due to PKC activation [ 40 ] .

text: The anti-inflammatory cytokine <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is known to inhibit T-cell activation , proliferation and the expression of pro-inflammatory cytokines , such as <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> INF-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> [ 39 , 43 ] and regulate inflammatory responses by inducing T-cell anergy [ 44 ] .

The time course analysis of cytokine expression showed a correlation between AP-1 and the chemokine <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> where CXCL8 expression was significantly elevated already at 2-6 h after PMA exposure .
The CXCL8 expression did not correlate with the early NF-kappaB activation ( 1 min ) or with the down-regulation of NF-kappaB at 2 h post exposure .
Both <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and TNF expression were up regulated between 6-24 h .

text: These observations indicate that the MAPK pathway and the transcription factor AP-1 play an important role in the induction of inflammatory responses in Jurkat T-cells [ 12 , 20 , 22 ] .
The obtained results signify that CXCL8 was primarily regulated through the MAPK pathway .

The NF-kappaB activation inhibitor ( NAI ) showed specificity against NF-kappaB and resulted in a complete <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibition following induction with PMA and significant <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> reduction after HK E . coli treatment .

text: Narayan and colleagues [ 27 ] suggested that deletion in any of the three CBM complex proteins impairs antigen-receptor dependent activation of NF-kappaB .

They showed that NF-kappaB activation via Akt requires <extra_id_0> CARMA1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and acts in cooperation with PKC following short-term exposure ( 30 min ) of Jurkat T-cells with PMA .
Akt phosphorylates and thus activates <extra_id_0> Bcl10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: These studies indicate that PKC is crucial for NF-kappaB activation following short-term treatment through signals via membrane bound receptors such as the TCR and the co-stimulatory receptor <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
Thus , the CBM complex proteins play a key role in this signalling process .
PMA diffuses into the cytosol and directly activates PKC since it is an analogue to diacylglycerol [ 48 ] .
Several studies have demonstrated that inhibition of PKC blocks NF-kappaB and AP-1 activity , suggesting a direct regulation of these transcription factors by PKC [ 49 , 50 ] .
PKC is activated at an early stage following T-cell stimulation and is therefore an important regulator of downstream inflammatory signalling pathways leading to cytokine expression [ 50 ] .
We have shown that phosphorylated - PKC is up regulated in response to PMA and HK E . coli , indicating an association between PKC and the transcription factors AP-1 and NF-kappaB .
<extra_id_0> Bcl10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> levels were down-regulated following extended treatment of Jurkat T-cells with PMA .

In the control groups , a loss of <extra_id_0> Bcl10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> occurred after 6 h , followed by an increase after 24 h , which is in accordance with the observed NF-kappaB activity ( figure 7 ) .

text: It has been shown that NF-kappaB is an important transcription factor complex involved in almost every aspect of cell regulation including apoptosis , differentiation , proliferation and initiation of immune responses [ 51-53 ] .
NF-kappaB is constitutively active in many human malignancies , which makes it an attractive therapeutic target [ 54 ] .

Elevated <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> levels during chronic inflammation result in an enhanced recruitment of immune cells to the site of infection , which may lead to the development of autoimmune diseases following secretion of pro-inflammatory cytokines .

In HIV infected persons , serum <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> levels are elevated and this could recruit more T-cells potentially leading to a more rapid progression of the disease since there will be more T-cells available to infect .
